thread.title: Relaxing Disney holidays

author: The Telegraph
title: Relaxing Disney holidays
text: There is plenty of excitement at Disney . But when you are not meeting your favourite characters, fitting in an action-packed day at one of Walt Disney World’s six parks or having fun at the sail-away and pirate parties on board the Disney Cruise ships, there are plenty of ways to relax. Pencil in some well-earned me time, whether it’s by the various pools on board a Disney Cruise or on Disney’s private island Castaway Cay. Guests on Disney Cruise Line’s Bahamas and Caribbean itineraries have exclusive access to the beautiful Castaway Cay - Disney’s private port-of-call paradise in the Bahamas. Balance your park days out with soaking up the sun or a spa treatment Relax among gently swaying palm trees on the powder-soft white sand and enjoy snorkelling, swimming and kayaking in the clear turquoise sea. On the Castaway Cay Family Beach you can lie back in a furnished cabana with a good book, indulge in some tasty alfresco barbecue food or enjoy water sports together as a family. Grown-ups can head to the adults-only Serenity Bay Beach for open air yoga and in-cabana massages to wind down without the kids, thanks to free childcare at Scuttle’s Cove. Family fun: Disney's Caribbean Resort is offer plenty of family-friendly activites If you feel like a bit of activity before beach time then a Port Adventure can be enjoyed by the whole family; why not try snorkelling and discover the colourful world lurking under the sea? Back on board your Disney Cruise there are plenty of places poolside to relax and recharge - from fun splash zones to Goofy’s pool on Disney Magic and Disney Wonder, where kids can play in the water while parents keep an eye on them from the comfort of the whirlpool spas. On the Disney Fantasy children can have fun in the AquaLab water play area and dance through the jets, geysers and fountains while parents supervise as they lounge in the wading pool nearby. Ship shape: adult-only pools on the ship offer a respite for grown-ups Mickey’s Pool gives kids a chance to let off steam on the waterslide and splash pools and the ships’ adult-only pools offer a respite for grown-ups when the children are busy at Kids Clubs and you are searching for some well-deserved peace and quiet. In Walt Disney World, there are also plenty of relaxation spots. Opt for a Disney hotel and you can balance your park days out with soaking up the sun around the pool, or even a spa treatment or two. Some, such as Disney’s Coronado Springs, even have “quiet pools” and others offer activities such as relaxing carriage rides at Disney Port Orleans Resort. At Epcot’s World Showcase, explore 11 different countries in one place Get into the holiday spirit at Disney’s Polynesian Village Resort and find yourself transported to the exotic islands of the South Pacific when you sunbathe on the white sand beach or take a dip in the tropical pool. Make a date to have some me time and enjoy a spa day to indulge in a signature aromatherapy body wrap and massage treatment at Walt Disney World’s Victorian-themed Grand Floridian Resort’s Senses spa. The Spa at Saratoga Springs Resort, inspired by the 19th-century health clubs of upstate New York, offers a serene sanctuary after a busy day with spa packages of pedicures, facials and massages designed to transport you to a peaceful place. In the parks, you can float gently along the Lazy River at Disney’s Blizzard Beach after a day on the thrilling water rides or stretch out on a beautiful white sand beach at Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon. Time to unwind: get pampered at the Grand Floridian Resort Senses spa At Epcot’s World Showcase, explore 11 different countries in one place. Enjoy a romantic Italian meal, then stroll across to France to quaff champagne. In the Magic Kingdom, stop off for a coffee on Main Street as you are serenaded by barbershop quartet Dapper Dans, or indulge in the Maharajah Jungle Trek through the lush delights of south-east Asia at Disney’s Animal Kingdom. For those who prefer to relax with a golf club in hand, there are even four amazing courses set among the natural beauty of the Florida woodlands at Disney. Whether you are soaking up the sun as a family on a private beach in the Bahamas or indulging in some well-deserved solo spa time, the signature Disney stellar service and friendly welcome means you can kick back and relax in style. • Find out more about Disney Cruises, Disney holidays and Walt Disney World
